climbs.name: Tigger
climbs.fa: Don Wilson, John Baker, Karen Wilson, Feb 2022

content.description: Ascends the orange and black striped rock at the right end of the crag. Climb up easy ground, then past 3 bolts to the anchor.
content.location: Located in the obvious orange and black striped rock at the right end of the crag.

climbs.name: Pigmy Goat Pillar
climbs.fa: Nicki Manzanares, Don Wilson, Karen Wilson, Feb 2022

content.description: Ascends good rock with fun climbing on the right end of the Petting Zoo. A good route for the beginning leader.
content.location: Right end of the Petting Zoo. Climbs the pillar-like buttress to the right of the orange striped rock.

content.description: Tricky start with thin feet to two cool crystal pockets, then slightly left and up. Very good rock and climbing for a teeny little route.
content.location: Leftmost route at the Petting Zoo. About 8 feet left of Baby Zebra.

climbs.name: Baby Zebra
climbs.fa: Karen Wilson, Don Wilson, John Baker January 2022

content.description: Goes straight up the center of the crag, on nice striped rock. Good climbing, but short.
content.location: Second route from the left. About 8 feet right of Maximus Hippo.

content.description: The Petting Zoo is a super short crag (25 to 40 feet) just below the Aviary. Rock quality is good. It features orange striped rock on its right side. Good climbing and worthwhile, despite the small stature. Some of these routes would be worthy of several stars, if only the crag was a little taller.
